channel.title: Need Some help
channel.description:
I'm looking to get into Website development which tools are decent and semi-beginner level ones?
Like bootstrap and things of that sort.

item.title: Need Some help
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

ox random xi:

how can someone learn html incorrectly? (only thing i’ve used W3 schools for)

Just general bad practices, undeclared or wrongly declared doctypes, uses of deprecated tags etc. Whole load of things I see on an almost daily basis.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Some help
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

how can someone learn html incorrectly? (only thing i’ve used W3 schools for)

Read full topic

item.title: Need Some help
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

w3Schools used to be shit, now it’s slightly better and roughly up to date. It’s carried its bad name for a long time now but it honestly isn’t bad as a REFERENCE. Do not use it for LEARNING.

As Pwnd said, it’s good for people to further their knowledge (or reference) but do not use it as a start point.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Some help
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

w3schools is good for smart people that know how to further their basis of knowledge far beyond the usage of one website. It actually helped me a lot when I was going through random templates online. I learned by example and using whatever resources I had if I had any questions.

Read full topic

item.title: Need Some help
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“ox random xi, post:7, topic:547291”][quote author=RevengePK link=topic=666198.msg4454615#msg4454615 date=1413915716]
Notepad ++ (Download NotePad + +) <- Code Editor

GIMP (Download GIMP) <- Graphics editor

A few tips before you get into your adventure:

  • GIMP is fine for graphic editting. You can do many of the same things with GIMP that you can do with Photoshop.
  • Having Photoshop over GIMP will not make you better at graphic design, the same goes with Dreamweaver over Notepad ++.
  • Do not use a Framework until you’re confident enough that you could create one yourself.
  • Take criticism and work with it, do not combat it.
  • Do not use W3Schools
    [/quote]whats wrong with W3Schools?[/quote]
    Look up w3fools, but they have been improving l. Nothing wrong with using it for reference.

Read full topic

item.description:

Consider learning Sass/Scss and use Jekyll!

item.title: Need Some help
item.dc:creator: @RevengePK RevengePK
item.description:
@RevengePK wrote:

Notepad ++ (Download NotePad + +) <- Code Editor

GIMP (Download GIMP) <- Graphics editor

A few tips before you get into your adventure:

  • GIMP is fine for graphic editting. You can do many of the same things with GIMP that you can do with Photoshop.
  • Having Photoshop over GIMP will not make you better at graphic design, the same goes with Dreamweaver over Notepad ++.
  • Do not use a Framework until you’re confident enough that you could create one yourself.
  • Take criticism and work with it, do not combat it.
  • Do not use W3Schools

item.title: Need Some help

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Not starting with that is good for beginners. Knowing basic HTML and CSS will go a really long way before you start getting to frameworks.
